tool.name: OSMGPWayLoader

param.name: in_osmWayFile
param.dialogReference: OpenStreetMap file containing the way elements to load in XML format.
param.pythonReference: OpenStreetMap file containing the way elements to load in XML format.

param.name: in_osmPointFC
param.dialogReference: Source point feature class representing the already loaded nodes. The geometry of the <nd> elements of the way are sourced from this feature class by the <id> of the node.
param.pythonReference: Source point feature class representing the already loaded nodes. The geometry of the <nd> elements of the way are sourced from this feature class by the <id> of the node.

param.name: in_polyline_fieldNames
param.displayname: Way tag keys to load for line features
param.dialogReference: Streamline the loading of line tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').
param.pythonReference: Streamline the loading of line tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

param.name: in_polygon_fieldNames
param.displayname: Way tag keys to load for polygon features
param.dialogReference: Streamline the loading of polygon tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').
param.pythonReference: Streamline the loading of polygon tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

param.name: out_osmWayLines
param.dialogReference: Name of the output line feature class. This feature class contains the way elements determined to represent a line feature.
param.pythonReference: Name of the output line feature class. This feature class contains the way elements determined to represent a line feature.

param.name: out_osmWayPolygons
param.dialogReference: Name of the output polygon feature class. This feature class contains the way elements determined to represent a polygon feature.
param.pythonReference: Name of the output polygon feature class. This feature class contains the way elements determined to represent a polygon feature.

tool.summary: This tool loads way elements from a OpenStreetMap XML File into a geodatabase and creates line and polygon features from the content.
tool.usage:
• The tool is used in combination with the OSM File Loader tool.

  • The tool only processes the way elements from the OpenStreetMap source file. It is assumed that the nodes already exist as a point feature class.

  • Streamline the loading of tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

scriptExample.title: Loading ways into line and polygon feature classes.
scriptExample.para: Load the way elements from the OpenStreetMap XML file into line and polygon feature classes. The source point feature class is already loaded by using the OSM Node Loader tool.
scriptExample.code:
# load the arcpy module import arcpy
# load the OpenStreetMap toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'C:\Program Files (x86)\ArcGIS\Desktop10.3\ArcToolbox\Toolboxes\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
# source point feature class source_points_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_pt'
# target line feature class line_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_ln'
# target polygon feature class polygon_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_ply'
# OpenStreetMap XML file osm_source = r'D:\OSM\liechtenstein-ways.osm'
# load the way elements into lines and polygons for Liechtenstein arcpy.OSMGPWayLoader_osmtools(osm_source, source_points_fc, '#', '#', line_fc, polygon_fc)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool loads way elements from a OpenStreetMap XML File into a geodatabase and creates line and polygon features from the content.
